data.title: About Me
data.text:
Hello out there!

My name is Jodi Jackson and I am a publicist here in Hollywood. Having been born and raised here, this is truly my town. My site is dedicated to showing you a real insiders Hollywood. You will come along with me to Hollywood, Beverly Hills and WEHO to all the parties, events, and openings along with cooking segments with wine parings and weekend getaways. So fasten your seat-belt and get ready to dig in to tinsel town!

Jodi Jackson Bio:

Jodi Jackson was in and around the entertainment industry from a very young age. Jodi’s father, Philip Jackson, owned a beauty salon in Beverly Hills. On any given day Jodi would see the likes of; Lana Turner, Judy Garland, Rosalind Russell, Rita Hayworth, Zsa Zia Gabor, and all Hollywood royalty. They would come to The Betty Jackson Salon as overflow from the studios to get ready for their glamorous films. They would pinch Jodi’s cheeks and she would run and hide behind the hair dryers. When Jodi was thirteen she was asked by one of her drama classmates to work on both the Jerry Lewis Muscular dystrophy Telethon and The Cerebral Palsy Telethon, with Paul Anka. She ran many errands for the show and made sure the 100’s of guests were well taken care of. Part AD, part PA, Jodi got the job done. She found both jobs so rewarding and was hooked. After high school she went up to San Francisco, to be closer to her father who lived up there. She attended The Academy of Art College and got a Bachelor of Interior Design, with a minor in Theater. She worked at a couple of prestigious Interior Design/ Architectural firms until she realized she wanted to have her designs on the big screen. While up there Jodi worked on the George Lucas movie “Howard the Duck” and then sought-after bigger fish back in Los Angeles. Upon arrival in Los Angeles, Jodi landed a Production Designer gig with Magic Hours Productions, where she worked on three different films. She was the secretary at The Set Decorators Society of America in Los Angeles. That was the job that got her foot in the door in Hollywood. She worked at Sandy Rose Floral designs, which did all of the flowers for many of the top soap operas. Jodi was then hired by F. Gary Gray to be the production designer on the music video Natural Born Killers, with Dr. Dre, Snoop Dog, and Ice Cube. During this time Jodi also did some award shows as a production assistant; The American Music Awards, The Grammys, The Ace Awards. She then got hired on two TV shows, Disney’s, The Crusaders, and Brillstein Grey’s short-lived traveling music show. Around that time, she was in talks with Studio Instrument Rental to be the manager of their new rehearsal space at The Old Directors guild on Sunset. She took the job and had some amazing clients and event experiences: The Beach Boys, Madonna, The Cars, night club promoters, play rehearsals, and many other Hollywood events. From there she worked at Priority Records in the Radio Promotion Department, The Eagles Record Label – Mission Records, where she was VP of A&R, and VP of Publicity. Jodi also worked at Red Ant Records before it closed and LPJ records as well. By using indie Publicity firms, Jodi began her relationship with CBG, The Courtney Barnes Group, where she worked off and on for eleven years. Her mentor, Courtney Barnes, taught her everything she knows about publicity in this very competitive global market. After CBG, Jodi started her PR Firm, JJ Entertainment, and has worked with many notable artists including, reality stars, actors, recording artists, fine artists, and restaurants. Jodi is a force to be reckoned with and her many talents creatively are what every artist needs to be turned into a household name. She has had up to three Grammy Nominees every year for the last ten years, with some wins and some losses. She continues to forge ahead even many obstacles due to a global pandemic and new technology. JJ Entertainment has gone through much professional resurgence but always keeps up with a new modern model of how to make an artist famous. She has no room for failure, which has been proven by her many satisfied clients. With a fantastic reputation and an abundance of creatively she perseveres in a world that continues to grow. JJ Entertainment is an iconic player in the world of publicity machines.

“I am just in the business of helping people, being of service, that is what gives me joy.” Jodi Jackson

Today Jodi is taking on publicity projects large and small, manages her ever-popular website and brand Jodi Jackson’s Hollywood, makes her handcrafted jewelry, JJ Designs Jewelry, and is writing a screenplay about her Father and growing up in Los Angeles, recounting her glamorous Hollywood life.

JJ Entertainment Info:

Over the past four years JJ Entertainment has had major successes for their A-List roster of clients; ranging from Grammy Award Winners to independent publicity campaigns. In 2014 we represented Pacific Mambo Orchestra, who won a Grammy in the Best Tropical Latin category. Following 2014’s success, JJ Entertainment spearheaded a Grammy award-winning press campaign in 2015 for 2 Grammy nominees: Jo-El Sonnier, who won for Best Regional Roots Album, and PALO! For Best Tropical Latin Album. In 2016, JJ Entertainment had 2 Grammy nominees for Best Instrumental Composition, “Neil,” Rich DeRosa, and Best Tropical Latin Album, “Que Suenen Los Tambores,” Victor Manuelle. JJ Entertainment has also embarked on some massive publicity campaigns, including a project with CBG and Universal Pictures actor Romany Malco; currently starring in the ABC hit show, “A Million Little Things,” and the Almost Christmas film release in November 2016.

Through very hard work JJ Entertainment had two more Grammy-nominated clients in 2017: Los Rakas and Jekalyn Carr, and another client Christie Lenee who was actively on tour. JJ Entertainment worked with Jersey Shore’s Ronnie Ortiz-Magro, on the new show “Jersey Shore Family Reunion,” which launched in March. For the 2018 Grammy Season, we’ve had the pleasure of working with Josh Tatofi for Best Regional Roots Music Album “Pua Kiele.” December 2018 we continued to work for County Pop Singer-Songwriter, Eileen Carey, Spanish Pop Star Alexa Lace, and navigating tour press for guitar virtuoso Jesse Cook. 2019 started off with a bang, doing Grammy Media for nominees Sean Ardoin who was double nominated for Best Regional Roots Music Album and Best American Roots Performance, and Victor Wainwright for Best Contemporary Blues Album. Supernatural songstress client Sayed Sabrina had an album release in August or 2019 as well as a release party. Doing the record release party for Katrina Stuart and her label, MusiCash, in September 2019, was a real honor. A new client from the UK, Asher Knight, jumped in on the scene and had his first college show, then opened for Naked Eyes and got nominated and performed for the Producers Choice Awards in Las Vegas. The delightful violinist virtuoso Eun Chong Ju, was a real success as well. Now with 9 Time Grammy Nominee Tierney Sutton Band, Tierney Sutton, 2020 will be super exciting. With the Grammy’s being the most exciting time for JJ Entertainment, 2020 promises to be another stellar year.

JJ Entertainment

Jodi Jackson

523 North Orlando, #8

Los Angeles, CA 90048

Tel 323.653.5438

JJ Entertainment was founded by Jodi Jackson, after spending many years cultivating a reputation and standard as a respected diligent publicist who gets the job done. In the short time JJ Entertainment has been in business, it has become an important and powerful force in entertainment publicity. The company has made significant inroads in film and television, while virtually covering the Pop/R&B/Rap/Hip Hop music genres.

Based in Los Angeles, CA. JJ Entertainment has strong professional relationships with all aspects of media, from magazines and newspapers to television, radio, and the Internet. Constant and effective contact with editors, columnists, talent bookers, and broadcaster has delivered the clients of JJ Entertainment to television (national and local news, talk and entertainment shows) and newsstands (newspapers and magazines from the local and regional levels on up to industry trade press and the most prominent consumer of publications).

JJ Entertainment is a close-knit staff who work in the most detailed manner possible. Every press angle is discussed and actively pursued, leaving no stone unturned. We reach out to our clients to ensure that their wishes and needs for a successful press campaign are heard and met. JJ Entertainment approaches publicity from a creative standpoint, coming up with fresh and innovative ways to get our clients the exposure they deserve.

To fully understand the work done by JJ Entertainment, one only needs to look at our client roster. All past and present clients are always kept in contact with, even as the company continues to grow, every client receives the same kind of personal attention they expect and deserve.

JJ Entertainment Rates:

A full PR Campaign: – $2500.00 a month retainer fee for a 4 – month guarantee.

Music Licensing: – $2500.00 a month for a 3-month guarantee.

Publicity for 1 show: – $1800.00.

Red Carpet: – $300.00.

Quarterbacking a Project: – $2500.00 a month – Putting together the team for a specific project and coordinating all aspects of communication, conference call, emails, etc, and anything else that goes into maintaining the campaign.

Special Events: – $2500.00 a month – This is to coordinate all things that go into a record release party, or any kind of event through the client.
